Not sure what I did... duplicated a couple of lines, then tried undo. Got this.

last four lines in trace repeat

I did this: in a saved java editor, I pressed Ctrl+Alt+Down, immediately
followed by Ctrl+Z.
Also reproducible in Text editor. Please raise priority.

Two distinct problems in the OperationApprover inside DefaultUndoManager

1 - if undo is invoked while folding into a compound change, the current 
compound change (fCurrent) will always be invalid.  Once it is determined that 
fCurrent should be committed, the folding parameter must be set to false or it 
won't commit.

2 - if commit fails (for the above reason or any unforeseen reason), then 
invoking another undo will cause operation approval on the same operation, 
causing the infinite loop.  There should be a guard in the method to ensure 
that undo is never invoked a second time if fCurrent didn't actually get 
committed.

Attaching patch.

Created an attachment (id=18983)
stack overflow patch

Created an attachment (id=18984)
test case patch

I've also attached a test case patch that reproduces the problem.  It would be 
good to include this in the jface text test suite.

Regarding the two problems discussed in comment #5

#1 - The change to set fFoldingIntoCompoundChange is reasonable.  But I'm left 
wondering why undo was invoked on an open compound change.  Dani - can you 
comment on whether this is a surprise?  Once these fixes are applied, should I 
still be looking for a deeper problem that caused the scenario (compound 
change left open)

#2 - The check for the failure to commit (preventing infinite undo sequence) 
is definitely appropriate for other cases.  Note that we should never get here 
unless something unexpected earlier has happened, causing a failure to commit 
the current edit.

Applied the patches.
Available in builds > 20050321

Re #1: the open compound change is a bug/open issue on our side: we have
commands (e.g. move/copy lines) which we like to treat as one change and hence
we begin a compound change. Since we do not how many times the user will invoke
the command we have several exit strategies that end the compound change. Until
recently there was no chance to know about other commands being executed and
hence the change is still open when undo is invoked. New experimental API has
been added that allows to listen for command execution. I filed bug 88632 to use
this on our side.

However, the undo manager must gracefully handle such a situation as done with
the attached patch.
*** Bug 88811 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 89289 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
